body: Alright, it's time to abandon my Logitech everyday mouse, and get myself something new. Problem is, my budget's something around $30. Help? :)
body_tagged: Alright, it's time to abandon my Logitech everyday mouse, and get myself something new. Problem is, my budget's something around $30. Help? :)
title: Gaming mouse under $30?

replies.body:
Best one that money can buy:

http://www.amazon.com/Programmable-Buttons-Profiles-specific-Switches/dp/B00CBQO930/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UT...

or if you need a mouse and keyboard:
http://www.amazon.com/CM-Storm-Devastator-Gaming-Keyboard/dp/B00DKXXAAQ/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=14015...

replies.body: Wow. Surprisingly both things I suggested says that the system requirements need to be windows.
replies.body_tagged: Wow. Surprisingly both things I suggested says that the system requirements need to be windows.

replies.body: You don't need a 'gaming' mouse.  A mouse is a mouse, and for 30 bucks you're better off going for one that isn't branded as gaming. You can get a better mouse for less if it isn't a gaming one. Just look for one that fits your hand, has solid build quality and good reviews on amazon.
replies.body_tagged: You don't need a 'gaming' mouse.  A mouse is a mouse, and for 30 bucks you're better off going for one that isn't branded as gaming. You can get a better mouse for less if it isn't a gaming one. Just look for one that fits your hand, has solid build quality and good reviews on amazon.

replies.body: Get a cheap Razer or Logitech gaming mouse of eBay. My friend has the Logitech g600 and I have the Razer orochi and both are amazing. But if you want a cheap one look for a Razer Deathadder or Logitech g500 on eBay.

reply_to.body: What makes a gaming mouse better??
reply_to.body_tagged: What makes a gaming mouse better??

replies.body: Well prices vary on EBay. The Orochi is good for clicking extremely fast but the Logitech g600 has loads of buttons. It's your choice really
replies.body_tagged: Well prices vary on EBay. The Orochi is good for clicking extremely fast but the Logitech g600 has loads of buttons. It's your choice really

replies.body:
It's more than the physical appearance that truly defines gaming mice.
Usually, gaming mouses have a quicker response time. It's also designed to be more flexible, whether that's the use of macros or  These mouses also come with a downloadable software, where many options are available. You can easily change DPI using this.

Plus, if you play FPS games, then do you need a gaming mouse. This is due to the fact that mouse undergoes maximum wear & tear during this genre of gaming.

Plus, if you play FPS games, then do you need a gaming mouse. This is due to the fact that mouse undergoes maximum wear & tear during this genre of gaming.
